item.title: Trig formula?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

I assume a figure is made out of n points where the points makes a closed shape (ie. the n-1 point is joined to the 1st point) and each point is connected to the adjacent points only. I shall label these points A-B-C-D…

Select a point. As the points make a “circle” it doesn’t matter where you start in terms of algorithm design. I select point A. Now proceed around the circle defining (n-2) triangles to fill. First triangle is A,B,C. Next is A,C,D. Next is A,D,E. There you have your completed figure.

Your choice of point does change the filled shape. I can think of an example that would show this but its hard to describe. I don’t have time to find the images at the moment but just try different start points and see where you get. As an example use 4 points and display the two different ways of filling it side by side.
